question.title: How to add a custom header value as a JWT claim in WSO2 API Manager 4.3.0?
question.body:
I'm working with WSO2 API Manager 4.3.0 and trying to add a custom claim to the JWT generated by the gateway.

Use case: I want to send a custom HTTP header (e.g., X-Custom-Id) in the request to the API Gateway, and have that header value included as a claim in the JWT that is passed to the backend service.

I've followed the official WSO2 documentation: Passing Enduser Attributes to the Backend, but I haven't been able to achieve the desired result — the custom header value is not appearing in the JWT claims.

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

Extended the APIMgtGatewayJWTGeneratorImpl class.

Overridden the populateStandardClaims and populateCustomClaims methods.

However, I'm not sure how to access the custom header (X-Custom-Id) from within those methods.

Question: How can I access a custom request header and add it as a JWT claim in a custom JWT generator?

Update:

I have successfully implemented the solution.

You can find the article explaining how to do this at the link below:

https://medium.com/@aabisabbas12/%EF%B8%8F-how-i-added-a-custom-jwt-claim-from-an-http-header-in-wso2-api-manager-6cf07f06577d
